story.text: CHICAGO Jan 2 The Chicago Mercantile Exchange CME.N said on Tuesday December's average daily derivatives volume was 5.4 million contracts, up 44 percent from a year before. Futures and options volume at the largest futures exchange also rose from November's 5.3 million contracts, and year on year growth was stronger than last month's 28 percent. CME said 2006 marked a seventh consecutive year of record volume. More than 1.3 billion contracts changed hands, with average daily volume for the year up 28 percent.
story.title: cme december trading volume jumps 44 pct on year
